info.author: Caroline Friedel
info.description: This tool provides useful metrics for validating library construction including the insert size distribution and read orientation of paired-end libraries. The expected proportions of these metrics vary depending on the type of library preparation used, resulting from technical differences between pair-end libraries and mate-pair libraries. For a brief primer on paired-end sequencing and mate-pair reads, see the GATK Dictionary. The CollectInsertSizeMetrics tool outputs the percentages of read pairs in each of the three orientations (FR, RF, and TANDEM) as a histogram. In addition, the insert size distribution is output as both a histogram (.insert_size_Histogram.pdf) and as a data table (.insert_size_metrics.txt). Note: Metrics labeled as percentages are actually expressed as fractions!
info.paperDescription: Insert size metrics were calculated with the picard library (%SOFTWARE_VERSION%).

param.name: Histogram_FILE
param.description: File to write insert size Histogram chart to. Required.

param.name: INPUT
param.description: Input SAM/BAM/CRAM file. Required.

param.name: OUTPUT
param.description: The file to write the output to. Required.

param.name: arguments_file
param.description: [optional] read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Default value: null.

param.name: COMPRESSION_LEVEL
param.description: [optional] Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF). Default value: 5.

param.name: DEVIATIONS
param.description: [optional] Generate mean, sd and plots by trimming the data down to MEDIAN + DEVIATIONS*MEDIAN_ABSOLUTE_DEVIATION. This is done because insert size data typically includes enough anomalous values from chimeras and other artifacts to make the mean and sd grossly misleading regarding the real distribution. Default value: 10.0.

param.name: GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS
param.description: [optional] Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path. Default value: client_secrets.json.

param.name: HISTOGRAM_WIDTHW
param.description: null

param.name: MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM
param.description: [optional] When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed. Default value: 500000.

param.name: METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL
param.description: [optional] The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Default value: [ALL_READS]. Possible values: {ALL_READS, SAMPLE, LIBRARY, READ_GROUP}

param.name: MIN_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH
param.description: [optional] Minimum width of histogram plots. In the case when the histogram would otherwise betruncated to a shorter range of sizes, the MIN_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH will enforce a minimum range. Default value: null.

param.name: MINIMUM_PCT
param.description: [optional] When generating the Histogram, discard any data categories (out of FR, TANDEM, RF) that have fewer than this percentage of overall reads. (Range: 0 to 1). Default value: 0.05.

param.name: REFERENCE_SEQUENCE
param.description: [optional] Reference sequence file. Default value: null.

param.name: STOP_AFTER
param.description: [optional] Stop after processing N reads, mainly for debugging. Default value: 0.

param.name: TMP_DIR
param.description: [optional] One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Default value: null.

param.name: VALIDATION_STRINGENCY
param.description: [optional] Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded. Default value: STRICT. Possible values: {STRICT, LENIENT, SILENT}

param.name: VERBOSITY
param.description: [optional] Control verbosity of logging. Default value: INFO. Possible values: {ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG}

param.name: ASSUME_SORTED
param.description: [optional] If true (default), then the sort order in the header file will be ignored. Default value: true. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: CREATE_INDEX
param.description: [optional] Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output. Default value: false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: CREATE_MD5_FILE
param.description: [optional] Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created. Default value:false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: INCLUDE_DUPLICATES
param.description: [optional] If true, also include reads marked as duplicates in the insert size histogram. Default value: false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: QUIET
param.description: [optional] Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err. Default value: false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: USE_JDK_DEFLATER
param.description: [optional] Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output. Default value: false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: USE_JDK_INFLATER
param.description: [optional] Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input. Default value: false. Possible values: {true, false}

param.name: version
param.description: [optional] display the version number for this tool

var.name: outputHistogramFile
var.description: output file containing the histogram of insert sizes

var.name: outputBamFile
var.description: txt file containing insert size metrics
